conclusion: The internal resistance of the power source is correctly identified as 0.5 Ω.
The resistance values of \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\) are correctly determined as 0.5 Ω and 1 Ω respectively.
The condition for maximum power transfer is correctly stated as when the external resistance equals the internal resistance of the source.
The series configuration results in an equivalent resistance of 2.5 Ω, which is farther from the internal resistance than the parallel configuration.
The parallel configuration results in an equivalent resistance of 0.6 Ω, which is closer to the internal resistance of 0.5 Ω.
The optimal configuration to maximize power output efficiency is connecting resistors \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\) in parallel.
